item.title: 19 years into this century, there should be passed laws giving people protections for their data, their person, and what permissions companies can reasonably ask for, which should rule out things like "keep uploaded face pictures forever." Its govt failure that it's not so.
item.dc:creator: Kelsey D. Atherton (@AthertonKD)
item.description: 19 years into this century, there should be passed laws giving people protections for their data, their person, and what permissions companies can reasonably ask for, which should rule out things like "keep uploaded face pictures forever." Its govt failure that it's not so.

item.title:
A number of people published their Neuralink stories without seeking outside comment or weighing the announcement with appropriate context.
The great @emilylmullin, of course, did not.
onezero.medium.com/elon-musk-want…
item.dc:creator: Damon Beres 🦇 (@dlberes)
